column4: Hi all. There is maxima compilation problem on ./configure stage: configure: error: No lisp implementation specified and none of the default executables clisp(clisp),gcl(GCL),lisp(CMUCL),scl(SCL),sbcl(SBCL),lisp(ACL),openmcl(OpenMCL),ecl(ECL) were found in PATH
What should i do?
try: sudo apt-get build-dep maxima;
Emm... Answer is: Unable to find source code for maxima
ahh yeah you need to enable source repos to do that, well, maxima using gcl in the default ubuntu version, so you could install that
or just enable the source repos in software-properties-gtk
Thanks...
Source code repositories enabled. But still not working
you need to apt-get update after changing the repos
i have armel architecture :D this is a big problem?
oh possibly
I don't know if maxima is available on armel, hmm
in the repos anyway
Sure, first of all i tryed to install maxima from rep
which ubuntu version is this? I see it built for armel on maverick+
On some webside i googled  someone said that should to install some lisp implementations. My ver is 11.10
on amd64/i386 it would be gcl, but it looks like gcl failed to build on armel
em... what is gcl? Is there no way to use gcl on almel?
gnu common lisp
I found gcl in repository. Installing
Thanks for help! There is new error :D Ill try to fix it by myself.
you're welcome, good luck, let me know if you need a hand
